items.title: Role switch not working with Ec2InstanceMetadata as credential_source

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to switch to another profile, an error occurs specifying that the 'source_profile' is missing. However the documentation states that 'source_profile' cannot be used with 'credential_source' (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/credref/latest/refdocs/setting-global-credential_source.html).

**Steps to reproduce**
I have an empty ```.aws/credentials``` file and the following ```.aws/config``` file:
```
[default]
region = eu-west-3

[profile dev]
region = eu-west-3
role_arn = arn:aws:iam::XXXXXXXXX:role/yyyyyyy
credential_source = Ec2InstanceMetadata
```
When I perform a command such as ```aws ec2 describe-instances --profile dev``` I receive no errors and the expected output. However, if I try to specify the following python code:
```
import boto3

session = boto3.Session(profile_name='dev')
session.instances('ec2')
```
I get a stacktrace when the code reaches the ```instances``` method.
The session object is however created without errors and I can successfully get the list of availables profiles with ```boto3.Session().available_profiles```.

**Expected behavior**
The switch to the "dev" role should occur.

**Debug logs**
```

    aws_session_token=aws_session_token, config=config)
```

items.title: SSML intermittent error

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
This is obviously being run against a database. Some events work. Some don't.

I have set the name, text1a, and text1b values the same in two different events for test purposes. If the script works for an event in the database, it doesn't matter what I have name, text1a, and text1b set to, it works. Likewise, if the script does not work for an event, it doesn't matter what I have name, text1a, and text1b set to, it won't work.


**Steps to reproduce**
Test data:
text1a = "Can you help us,"
names = "Bob and Dotty?"
text1b = "Please respond today."

The code is:

```
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

import apv
import audioread
import boto3
from boto3 import client
from boto3 import Session
from botocore.exceptions import BotoCoreError, ClientError
import csv
import mysql.connector
from mysql.connector import Error
import os
import sys
import wave

access_key = apv.aws["aws_key1"]
secret_key = apv.aws["aws_key2"]

polly_client = boto3.Session(
    aws_access_key_id=access_key,
    aws_secret_access_key=secret_key,
    region_name='us-west-2').client('polly')
   
event_ID = sys.argv[1]
event = str(event_ID)

pathout = "/var/www/html/data/event"

db_host = apv.sql["host"]
db_name = apv.sql["name"]
db_user = apv.sql["user"]
db_pass = apv.sql["pass"]
db_port = apv.sql["port"]
        
db = mysql.connector.connect(
    host = db_host,
    database=db_name,
    user=db_user,
    password=db_pass,
    port=db_port)
    
sql_select_Query = "select * from Voice where event_ID = %s"
cursor = db.cursor()
cursor.execute(sql_select_Query, (event_ID,))
record = cursor.fetchall()
for row in record:
    voice = row[1]
    names = row[2]
    text1a = row[3]
    text1b = row[4]
text1 = text1a + " " + names + " " + text1b
    
#if voice == "Matthew" or voice == "Joanna":
#    spkOpen = '<speak><amazon:domain name="news">'
#    spkClose = '</amazon:domain></speak>'
#else:
spkOpen = '<speak>'
spkClose = '</speak>'
    
fileOut1 = pathout + event + '/event' + event + '-1.wav'
response1 = polly_client.synthesize_speech(VoiceId=voice,
    Engine='neural',
    OutputFormat='pcm',
    TextType='ssml',
    Text=spkOpen + text1 + spkClose)

wav_file = wave.open(fileOut1, 'wb')
wav_file.setparams((1, 2, 16000, 0, 'NONE', 'NONE'))
wav_file.writeframes(response1['AudioStream'].read())
```

**Expected behavior**
I expect the script to either work consistently (ideally), or fail consistently so I can debug it.

**Debug logs**
For the case where it doesn't work, I get the following results when I run the script:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/www/html/py-scripts/wed-voice1.py", line 66, in <module>
    Text=spkOpen + text1 + spkClose)
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 316, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 635, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.errorfactory.InvalidSsmlException: An error occurred (InvalidSsmlException) when calling the SynthesizeSpeech operation: Invalid SSML request
```

Any idea what the problem might be? Can you suggest a work around?

items.title: Boto3 comprehend client list_document_classification_jobs example is misleading

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue is a duplicate.

items.body:
**The bug**
Boto3 comprehend client `list_document_classification_jobs` example is misleading

Copy paste the [example request syntax](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/comprehend.html#Comprehend.Client.list_document_classification_jobs) from boto3's documentation
```python
response = client.list_document_classification_jobs(
    Filter={
        'JobName': 'string',
        'JobStatus': 'SUBMITTED'|'IN_PROGRESS'|'COMPLETED'|'FAILED'|'STOP_REQUESTED'|'STOPPED',
        'SubmitTimeBefore': datetime(2015, 1, 1),
        'SubmitTimeAfter': datetime(2015, 1, 1)
    },
    NextToken='string',
    MaxResults=123
)
```

Got the following Exception
```python
InvalidRequestException: An error occurred (InvalidRequestException) when calling the ListDocumentClassificationJobs operation: 
Filters, if specified, must specify exactly 1 filter.
```

**Steps to reproduce**
```python
response = client.list_document_classification_jobs(
    Filter={
        'JobName': 'A-Classification-Job',
        'JobStatus': 'COMPLETED'
    },)
```

**Expected behavior**
Highlight and explain the expected input format.
> You can only set one filter at a time.

We should not put an example that is not working in documentation as it can mislead readers.

items.title: S3 client causes Segmentation fault when used with mysql.connector

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
my env

```
boto3==1.14.28
botocore==1.17.28
mysql-connector-python==8.0.21
Python 3.8.4 [GCC 8.3.0] on docker `python:3.8-slim-buster`
```

Reproduce easily

```
import boto3
from mysql.connector import errorcode

aws_session = boto3.Session(region_name='ap-southeast-2')
sqs_client = aws_session.resource('sqs')
print('sqs')
s3_client = aws_session.client('s3')
print('s3')
print(s3_client.list_buckets())
```

produces

```
sqs
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

comment out `from mysql.connector import errorcode` and it produces desired results;

```
sqs
s3
{'ResponseMetadata': ...
... etc
```

Any chance we can make boto3 work with the mysql.connector considering it is needed for RDS/Aurora?

I have naively ruled out the bug being a problem with `mysql.connector` using process of elimination. i.e. My existing app worked flawlessly using `mysql.connector`, i later added boto3 session for `resource('sqs')` and has been working for weeks, then i added `resource('s3')` and encountered Segmentation fault. Therefore the replication shows how SQS works but S3 fails, leading me to believe that boto3 likely works well with `mysql.connector` in general, both projects are not causing the segfault as a general incompatibility, but it is narrowed down to S3 client code path being the root cause that introduced the segfault.

thanks

items.title: Missing support for AWS Transcribe Streaming

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: This issue requests a feature.

items.body:
The boto libraries have no support for talking to the Transcribe **Streaming** which uses a custom message system and talk using HTTP2 or websocket.

Functions such `start_stream_transcription` and the other necessary pieces for Event Stream Encoding are missing:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/API_streaming_StartStreamTranscription.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/event-stream.html

Are there plans for making this available anywhere in the near future? These tools are available only on the Java SDK v2 for now.

**Expected behavior**
When I call copy object, all the destination (copied) files should be copied without being corrupted

I can add if necessary, please let me know.

items.title: Sagemaker list_models MaxResults argument doesn't work

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
The MaxResults kwarg seems to restrict the model search before applying the search criteria instead of doing it afterwards. The restriction seems to be the first *MaxResults* model results as sorted by descending chronological order.

Example:

```python
import boto3
sm = boto3.client("sagemaker")
model_name = 'foobar'
sm.list_models(NameContains=model_name)
sm.list_models(NameContains=model_name, MaxResults=2)
```

If the order of models from newest to oldest is "bar-1, bar-2, foobar-1, foobar-2", the first search returns the expected `foobar` models, but the second search returns no models.

**Expected behavior**
MaxResults filters out the number of models in the response after all models have been searched.

labels.name: guidance

items.body:
I'm using AWS sdk in my Python Lambda function to get Cognito User's attributes. Like this code:

```
def get_cognito_user_attributes(pool_id, region, email):
    cognito_client = boto3.client('cognito-idp')
    
    if pool_id is not None:
        try:
            response = cognito_client.admin_get_user(
                UserPoolId=pool_id,
                Username=email
            )
            
            if response is not None and 'Username' in response and 'UserAttributes' in response:
                attrs = {}
                
                for attr in response['UserAttributes']:
                    name = attr['Name']
                    name = name.replace('custom:', '')
                    attrs[name] = attr['Value']
                    
                print(attrs)
                return attrs
            else:
                return None
                
        except ClientError as e:
            if e.response['Error']['Code'] == 'UserNotFoundException':
                print("USER NOT FOUND", "pool_id:", pool_id, "region:", region, "email:", email)
                return None
            
            raise e
            
    return None
```

And my lambda handler is like this:

```
def lambda_handler(event, context):

    try:
        if 'Records' in event:
            records = event['Records']
            
            for record in records:
                content = json.loads(record['body'])
                message = json.loads(content['Message'])
                check_alarm(message)
 ```

labels.name: closing-soon
labels.description: This issue will automatically close in 7 days unless further comments are made.

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
The `list_notebook_instances` Sagemaker method does not list all Sagemaker notebook instances for a given region.

**Steps to reproduce**
boto3 version: `1.14.21`
Python version: `3.8.1`

Code to reproduce:
```
import boto3
SM = boto3.client('sagemaker', region_name='us-east-1')
nb_instances = SM.list_notebook_instances()
```

**Expected behavior**
When no filters/arguments are provided to the method, _all_ Sagemaker notebook instances should be returned. Instead, only a handful of them are returned.

items.title: SNS subscription attribute values are 'false' strings not bools

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**

SNS Subscription attributes are strings, when they should be bools.

So if the value is `'false'`, and you try to use that in an `if` statement, it evaluates as `True`.

**Steps to reproduce**

```
import boto3

sns = boto3.resource('sns')
topic = list(sns.topics.all())[0]
subscription = list(topic.subscriptions.all())[0]
attr = subscription.attributes
```

```
>>> attr
{'Owner': '945703836811', 'RawMessageDelivery': 'false', 'TopicArn': 'arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:945703836811:CodeCommit', 'Endpoint': '+61415762868', 'Protocol': 'sms', 'PendingConfirmation': 'false', 'ConfirmationWasAuthenticated': 'true', 'SubscriptionArn': 'arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:945703836811:CodeCommit:86c98c03-f146-4998-924b-e8377cd58e7f'}
>>> attr['PendingConfirmation']
'false'
>>> type(attr['PendingConfirmation'])
<class 'str'>
```

**Expected behavior**

Subscription attributes like `PendingConfirmation` should be bools, not strings.

items.title: Client loses Lambda connection after 300 secs (per OP from #2325)

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
This is in reference to #2325 - that issue was closed without a resolution.

Evidence here:

From the scripts log. Note the client is set to time out at 15 minutes, and it does so as instructed.
```
2020-07-11 19:25:33.237197	DEBUG: Start Lambda: 07/11/2020, 19:25:33
2020-07-11 19:40:33.431392	ERROR: Error invoking lambda
2020-07-11 19:40:33.431446	ERROR: Read timeout on endpoint URL: "https://lambda.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/2015-03-31/functions/*********/invocations"
2020-07-11 19:40:33.431480	DEBUG: Finish Lambda: 07/11/2020, 19:40:33
```

From the Cloudwatch logs - note the Lambda finishes in just about 7 minutes:

```
2020-07-11T15:25:35.093-04:00  START RequestId: 6204a7f0-1673-432f-9098-d1b4b5c2de8e Version: $LATEST
2020-07-11T15:32:32.042-04:00  END RequestId: 6204a7f0-1673-432f-9098-d1b4b5c2de8e
2020-07-11T15:32:32.042-04:00  REPORT RequestId: 6204a7f0-1673-432f-9098-d1b4b5c2de8e	Duration: 416944.79 ms	Billed Duration: 417000 ms	Memory Size: 128 MB	Max Memory Used: 92 MB	Init Duration: 962.30 ms	
```

I cannot verify the original statement about a 300 second issue, but this worked fine for a long time until the data set on which this was operating grew large enough to extend the Lambda execution time to longer than 5 minutes. So there is definitely something happening with the client's connection to Lambda independent of the timeout set for the client.

BTW, this is happening with `v.1.10.45` but I will be testing with the latest version. Expecting the same result given there are no other discussions regarding this issue.

Thanks for you help

If you have a runnable example, please include it as a snippet or link to a repository/gist for larger code examples.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Debug logs**
Full stack trace by adding `boto3.set_stream_logger('')` to your code.


No bugs, just a quick recommendation that perhaps asking the customer to include the SDK version may be helpful. Could help identify issues quicker. I don't recall if `boto3.set_stream_logger('')` includes this, apologies ahead of time.

items.title: iam.list_mfa_devices UserName regex doesn't match

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**

IAM.Client.list_mfa_devices does not seem to match any username using regex.

The documentation also refers to a "regex pattern", but I've been unable to match any user using regex after trying dozens of queries. Any example of how regex can be used here would be massively appreciated if this isn't a bug.

**Steps to reproduce**

I've tried the following snippet:

`iam: botostubs.IAM = session.client("iam")
iam_result = iam.list_mfa_devices(UserName=".+")`

I've also tried using every combination of alphanum + `+=,.@_-` to build a regex, but to no avail.

**Expected behavior**

Specify a regex such as `.+` to match nay user to list all mfa_devices for all users - similar to how `list_virtual_mfa_devices()` returns devices for all users.

items.title: Documentation for cloudwatch put_metric_data StorageResolution has invalid example

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue is a duplicate.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This issue requests an improvement to a current feature.

items.body:
The documentation for [CloudWatch `put_metric_data` call, value `StorageResolution`](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/cloudwatch.html#CloudWatch.Client.put_metric_data) has value `123` in the "Request Syntax" dictionary.

But in the text below, it says:

> Valid values are 1 and 60. ... This field is optional, if you do not specify it the default of 60 is used.

I believe the documentation should not have the invalid value of 123.
It should have a valid value of either 1 or 60.

Since 60 is cheaper, and the default, it should be 60.

items.title: ec2.describe_managed_prefix_lists doesn't return non-AWS managed lists in west/east-2 regions

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Running `boto3.client('ec2').describe_managed_prefix_lists()` returns only the AWS managed prefix lists and not any custom prefix lists for the us-east/west-2 regions. The us-east/west-1 regions work as expected.

boto3==1.14.19
botocore==1.17.19
python==3.6.5

**Steps to reproduce**
Create a prefix list in us-west-2 and us-west-1. Use boto3 EC2 client to describe all of the prefix lists.
```python
import boto3
session = boto3.session.Session(profile_name='saml') #change profile to your env

def test(client):
  prefixListName = '%s-test' % client.meta.region_name
  r = client.create_managed_prefix_list(
    PrefixListName=prefixListName,
    MaxEntries=60,
    Entries=[
      {
        'Cidr': '10.0.0.1/32'
      }
    ],
    AddressFamily='IPv4'
  )
  assert prefixListName  in [x['PrefixListName'] for x in client.describe_managed_prefix_lists()['PrefixLists']], "The list %s was not found in the describe operation" % prefixListName

# Test us-west-1 which creates the list and describes it successfully
client = session.client('ec2', region_name='us-west-1')
test(client)

# Test us-west-2 which creates the list but fails to describe it
client = session.client('ec2', region_name='us-west-2')
test(client)
```

**Expected behavior**
Both asserts pass, but the second assert for the us-west-2 client fails. This can also be replicated in the us-east region with us-east-1 being successful and us-east-2 failing in the second assert.

**Debug logs**
https://schnwil.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/boto3.ec2.describe_managed_prefix_lists.debug

Check your key and signing method.

items.body:
Contrary to documentation, boto3.client("s3").head_bucket(Bucket=bucket_name) does not throw S3.Client.exceptions.NoSuchBucket. It throws An error occurred (404) when calling the HeadBucket operation: Not Found
https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/s3.html#S3.Client.head_bucket

```
import boto3
client = boto3.client("s3")
try:
    client.head_bucket(Bucket='bucket-does-not-exist')
except client.exceptions.NoSuchBucket:
    print('exception caught')
```

The above code snippet should print 'exception caught'. However, It throws the below exception.

Please align documentation and behavior of exception thrown.

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Im currently using boto3 to upload files to my aws buckets. The thing is, im using upload_fileobj from client, and it doesn't matter what I give in Config as a parameter, it always have the same behaviour.

**Steps to reproduce**
```
from io import BytesIO
from os import environ
import pandas as pd
import boto3
boto3.set_stream_logger('')
report = pd.DataFrame(columns=['a'], data=[[x] for x in range(150000)])
bucket = 'mybucket'
stream = BytesIO()
report.to_excel(stream, index=False, engine='openpyxl')
stream.seek(0)
path_with_extension = 'dev/myfile.xlsx'
content_type = 'application/vnd.ms-excel'
client = boto3Client('s3', aws_access_key_id=environ['AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID'], aws_secret_access_key=environ['AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'])
config = TransferConfig(use_threads=True)
print('Uploading File')
client.upload_fileobj(
    stream, bucket, path_with_extension, Config=config, Callback=print,
    ExtraArgs={'ContentType': content_type, 'ACL':'public-read'}
)
print('File uploaded')
```

**Expected behavior**
The code above, would expect to use threads, but the output I see on my console is 
```
Uploading File
262144
262144
262144
262144
102255
File uploaded
```

items.body:
I am trying to process a large file from S3 and to avoid consuming large memory, using get_object to stream the data from file in chunks, process it, and then continue. 

But, after some interactions facing connection reset error.

Example code:
```
s3_client = boto3.client('s3', aws_access_key_id=ACCESS_KEY, aws_secret_access_key=SECRET_KEY)
response = s3_client.get_object(Bucket=BUCKET_NAME, Key=KEY)
response_feeds = gzip.open(response.get('Body', ''), 'rt')
while True:
	# Creating feeds batch
	feeds_batch = [feed for _, feed in zip(range(2000), response_feeds) if feed]
	if not feeds_batch:
```

items.title: rds-data unable to parameterize postgresql json queries

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
It seems the parameter schema in rds-data does not accomodate postgresql JSONB query language.

The following query will fail because rds-data refuses to parameterize ":phone_number" as it is wrapped in double quotes.
`'''select * from table where data->'fields' @> '[{"value":[":phone_number"]}]' '''`

Whereas, the next query fails because rds-data stringifies :phone_number and thus the query is no longer valid json.
`'''select * from table where data->'fields' @> '[{"value":[:phone_number]}]' '''`

Thoughts?

items.title: Update ACM Waiter

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Writing a script that will request a private certificate (**using an ACM PCA**) via ACM and then immediately export that certificate for use on an end entity. Currently using the only waiter ("certificate_validated") for ACM in boto3 and it ends after reaching a "successful state" which happens to be "PENDING_VALIDATION". This prevents me from being able to export the certificate **after the waiter completes because it still takes a couple seconds for the certificate to be in an issued state and exportable**. Also confusing as the waiter name is "certificate_validated" when the waiter actually doesn't 'wait' for the certificate to be in that state. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be nice to have an additional flag for the waiter to wait until a particular status is reached OR have an additional waiter that specifically waits until a user can call get_certificate successfully.

items.title: Specifying S3 Virtual Syle Hosted Endpoint for Fips Reverts to Path Style

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Creating an S3 client and specifying a fips endpoint URL with the [virtual hosted style addressing](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/VirtualHosting.html#virtual-hosted-style-access), the client ends up reverting to path style addressing.

We understand that S3 fips endpoints are [only supported with virtual hosted style addresses](https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/fips/) and that only virtual hosted style addresses will be supported for buckets created after [September 30, 2020](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/amazon-s3-path-deprecation-plan-the-rest-of-the-story/). The clients reverting to path-style addressing then becomes a problem for us.

How do we force our clients to use the virtual hosted style tips endpoints?

**Steps to reproduce**
Client instantiation example:
```
s3 = boto3.client("s3", endpoint_url="https://<bucketname>.s3-fips.<region>.amazonaws.com")
```
Calls and testing after instantiations use path style endpoints rather than virtual hosted style.

**Expected behavior**
The client should continue using the endpoint URL ``https://<bucketname>.s3-fips.<region>.amazonaws.com`` rather than reverting to the path style address.

**Debug logs**
n/a

@shepdelacreme

items.title: Filter values for CodeCommit list_repositories()

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

labels.name: service-api
labels.description: This issue is caused by the service API, not the SDK implementation.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently the CodeCommit client does not include built-in filtering options. [1] This prevents users from pulling repository information based on tags efficiently.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Ideally customers would be able to accomplish something similar to what can be seen below with the list_repositories() method. [2] 

Alternatively, the addition of a describe_repositories() method similar to the EC2 client's describe_instances() method. This would look something similar to the current ability within the EC2 client's describe_instances() method. [3] 

```
import boto3
client = boto3.client('codecommit')
response=client.list_repositories(
    nextToken='string',
    sortBy='repositoryName'|'lastModifiedDate',
    order='ascending'|'descending',
    filters=[
        {
            'Name': 'string',
            'Values': [
                'string',
            ]
        },
    ])
```


[1] https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/collections.html#filtering

[2] https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/codecommit.html

[3] https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/ec2.html#EC2.Client.describe_instances

items.title: Resource Groups Tagging API paginates forever and no new results are returned

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm attempting to get all resources that contain a set of tags using the `resource_groups_tagging_api. get_resources` api. However, it seems that it continues to loop over the same results forever while still providing a pagination token for additional results. I am using the `TagFilters` and `ResourceTypeFilters` kwargs.

For example, I have experienced the following:
1. make the initial request, get no results but have a pagination token
2. make another request using the pagination token, receive results and a new pagination token
3. make another request using the pagination token, receive no results but have a new pagination token
4. make another request, receive the same results from step `2` and a new pagination token
5. continues forever

We don't have many resources with the tags (~5 resources) so I'd assume this api call would have no issues. It has work for us in the past, however, this is the first time we're looking to use the pagination token to get additional results.

**Steps to reproduce**
See steps above. It happens whenever interacting with resource_groups_tagging_api.

**Expected behavior**
based on the documentation of [resource_groups_tagging_api.get_resources](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/resourcegroupstaggingapi.html#ResourceGroupsTaggingAPI.Client.get_resources) I would expect that `PaginationToken` would be set to `null` if no additional results are available. 

```
You can check the PaginationToken response parameter to determine if a query is complete. Queries occasionally return fewer results on a page than allowed. The PaginationToken response parameter value is null only when there are no more results to display.
```

**Debug logs**
Can provide more details if needed

items.title: OverflowError: cannot fit 'int' into an index-sized integer - during s3.upload_file

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
I can successfully upload files up to 2GB in size but get an error when I try and upload anything larger and hit the 2GB/2147483648 byte limit. The last few lines of the error are:

  File "c:\users\osdm\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages\botocore\handlers.py", line 225, in conditionally_calculate_md5
    calculate_md5(params, **kwargs)
  File "c:\users\osdm\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages\botocore\handlers.py", line 198, in calculate_md5
    if request_dict['body'] and 'Content-MD5' not in params['headers']:
OverflowError: cannot fit 'int' into an index-sized integer

Key parts of the script I run,with the profile_name and endpoint replaced with dummy values, are:
#force multipart uploads to be the largest they can be (5GB)
GB = 1024 ** 3
config = TransferConfig(multipart_threshold=5*GB, multipart_chunksize=5*GB)

#use the appropriate profile and endpoint in the aws config file
session = boto3.session.Session(profile_name='blahblah').client('s3',endpoint_url='http://alocalcloud.co.uk')

#upload the file
try:
    response = session.upload_file(srcpath, bucketname, keyname, Config=config)

except ClientError as e:
    print("error1=",e)
    print("error2=",e.response['Error']['Message'])

Any ideas how I can fix this, and happy to make some local amendments to the botocore files to keep things working. 

Lee

items.title: Allow pagination for logs start_query() and get_query_results()

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
Currently we can get up to 10000 logs using start_query() and get_query_results in using code like here:
```
client = boto3.client('logs')
executeQuery = client.start_query(
       logGroupName='LOGGROUPNAME',
       startTime=STARTDATE,
       endTime=ENDDATE,
       queryString='fields status',
       limit=10000
   )
getQueryId=executeQuery.get('queryId')
getQueryResults = client.get_query_results(
    queryId=getQueryId
  )
```
Neither start_query nor get_query_results allow pagination (`can_paginate() == False` for both). 

This is the request for allowing pagination for `start_query()` and `get_query_results()` unless there is some other way to get more than 10000 logs from `start_query()`.

items.title: Out of Direct Memory while Getting a file from S3
items.body:
Trying to read a list of files from S3 lying in a bucket. 

``
csv_obj = s3.Object(bucket_name, key).get(Range='bytes=0-2048')
``

It runs fine for the first couple of files and then out of memory arises. 

org.python.netty.util.internal.OutOfDirectMemoryError: org.python.netty.util.internal.OutOfDirectMemoryError: failed to allocate 16777216 byte(s) of direct memory (used: 2080374784, max: 2092957696) in <script> at line number 99

FIles are very small in size(max around 20MB, averaging around 4-5MB).

items.title: AWS SSM list compliance boto3 report have bug

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**

I was collecting SSM list compliance data for multiple instances using AWS-CLI individually but so make it automate with boto3 getting the response with very few patches says for example 50 patches for each instance.  
So aws CLI gives exact patch list but boto3 python gives standard 50 patches for each instance.

**Steps to reproduce**

AWS CLI command

 aws ssm list-compliance-items --resource-ids "instance id" --resource-type ManagedInstance 

Equivalent boto3

list_compliance_items

Python 3.6.8 
>>> import boto3
>>> client = boto3.client('ec2')
>>> ssm_client = boto3.client('ssm')
>>> ssm_resp = ssm_client.list_compliance_items(ResourceIds=["instance-id"],ResourceTypes=['ManagedInstance'])
>>> print(ssm_resp)


**Bug**

There is less number of patches per instances while in boto3 list compliance report module.

items.title: Error "An error occurred (404) when calling the HeadObject operation: Not Found" while accessing S3 Object fields

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Unable to get S3.Object fields for "directory" object only if it was created via boto3 API.

When we create directories manually in AWS S3 Web-Console everything works fine.

**Important**
We have two user accounts with AdministratorAccess permission:
- First for s3-bot and programmatically access.
- Second for user and manual manipulations with S3 Service.

**Steps to reproduce**

### **This leads to ERROR 404**
1. Create clear bucket (for example, "test-bucket") manually in AWS S3 Web-Console.
2. Upload file with two sub-directories in path (for example, "first/second/file.txt"):

```
s3_resource = boto3.resource(
        "s3", 
        aws_access_key_id="my_access_key_id", 
        aws_secret_access_key="my_secret_access_key", 
        region_name="us-east-1"
    )
    
bucket = s3_resource.Bucket(name="test-bucket")
bucket.upload_file(Filename=r"c:\test\file.txt", Key="first/second/file.txt")
```

3. Try to get object of "first/" directory and print it's content length:
```
first_dir = bucket.Object(key=r"first/")
print(first_dir.content_length)
```
4. Here comes error **botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (404) when calling the HeadObject operation: Not Found**.

### **This work's fine**

1. Create clear bucket (for example, "test-bucket-2") manually in AWS S3 Web-Console.
2. Create manually nested directory structure in your new bucket - "first_dir/second_dir/".
3. Try to get object of "first_dir/" directory and print it's content length:
```
s3_resource = boto3.resource(
        "s3", 
        aws_access_key_id="my_access_key_id", 
        aws_secret_access_key="my_secret_access_key", 
        region_name="us-east-1"
    )
    
bucket = s3_resource.Bucket(name="test-bucket")
first_dir = bucket.Object(key=r"first_dir/")
print(first_dir.content_length)
```
4. Now we have our "content_length" value.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

items.title: Update to the describe tags method for all the servies

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue is a duplicate.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: This issue requests a feature.

items.body:
**Different describe tags response for different services**
The issue is that there is **no definite structure** for the **describe tags API** method. For some services, it uses resource names to get the tags for the particular resource while for some it can be used without passing any arguments to list the tags of all resources in that service.

As there isn't a definite structure, it becomes really hard to use the combination of those services as it varies a lot. To name a few services, **EC2** has a different structure than **ELB** or **ELBv2**. 
As **EC2**, describe tags method can directly be called to get the tags of all the resources. While for **ELB** and **ELBv2** we have to specify the **Resource ID** to fetch the tags for the resource.

Below are the boto3 links for both the tags method:
**EC2**: [Describe Tags](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/ec2.html#EC2.Client.describe_tags)
**ELB**: [Describe Tags](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/elb.html#ElasticLoadBalancing.Client.describe_tags)


**Proposed Solution**
To solve this issue, we can opt for the structure as the same goes for the **ELB** or **ELBv2** as it is easier to use that structure in which we have to pass the Resource ID to get the tags. Rather than getting all the tags. 
This structure can also be helpful if the developer is building something on top of the API as generally everything works on the resource by resource basis.

Kindly look into the request and let me know if you need some clarity on the issue.

Thank you

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

The documentation for boto3 says to refer to the api documentation for what errors should be handled for the boto3 client, however the exception handling classes specified in:

These do not handle all the error codes that can be thrown from the s3 api.

Some examples of how to use boto3 to download_files with the correct exception handling and some more exception handling classes would be helpful.

items.title: The way boto3 handles tagging is completely retarded
items.body:
Tags should be presented as a dict:
{'tag name': 'tag value'}

I know this has been like this forever but this way of presenting tags is the most retarded python thing I have ever seen. 

If I want to upsert a tag on an S3 bucket (which it just so happens I do), I need to get the existing tags, loop through them looking for a tag key that matches the name I'm after, update the Value to the new value I want it to be and then put all of the tags on the bucket. And I need to handle the case that the tag doesn't exist and create it. But I can't even do that simply because I need "if tag['Key'] == 'mytagname'" within the for loop searching through the tags, meaning I needed to keep track of whether I actually found the tag at the end and then if not create a new entry in the list.

All of this could have been a tag_set.update({'tagname':'tagvalue'}) if it was presented as a dict.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Update all the service clients to support a dict style tagging interface.

labels.name: needs-triage

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
I've written a lambda to extract text from image files stored in s3. The lambda is triggered by new objects. The images are stored in folders.
When I test on files stored on the root of my S3 bucket, everything works fine. When I use a folder, things break. 

When the documentLocation looks like this:
`{'S3Object': {'Bucket': 'extractbucket', 'Name': 'img024.jpg'}}`
everything works. When it looks like this:
`{'S3Object': {'Bucket': 'extractbucket', 'Name': 'afold/img024.jpg'}}`
I get the `InvalidParameterException`

**Steps to reproduce**
Here's my lambda function (Python3.8, region:us-east-2):
```
import json
import boto3

def lambda_handler(event, context):

    bucket="extractbucket"
    client = boto3.client('textract')
    jobFile = event['Records'][0]['s3']['object']['key']
    #process using S3 object
    docLoc = {
        "S3Object":{
            "Bucket": bucket,
            "Name": jobFile
        }
    }
    response = client.start_document_text_detection(
        DocumentLocation=docLoc,
        JobTag=jobFile,
        NotificationChannel={
            "RoleArn":"arn:aws:iam::xxxxx:role/Textract_demo_sns",
            "SNSTopicArn": "arn:aws:sns:us-east-2:xxxxx:TxtExtractComplete"
        }
    )
      return {
        'statusCode': 200,
        'body': json.dumps("sent filejobID:" + jobFile + " to queue")
    }      

```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect that when testing against file: image123.jpg, and alternate file nextFolder01/image1234.jpg that both files would be processed by the engine.

**Debug logs**
```
InvalidParameterException: An error occurred (InvalidParameterException) when calling the StartDocumentTextDetection operation: Request has invalid parameters
```

items.title: Send email via SES VPCEndpoint

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

VPC Endpoints for SES were [announced recently](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/new-amazon-simple-email-service-ses-for-vpc-endpoints/).

However, if you try to send an email via boto3 SES, the client will use the default URL (email.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com), which doesn't connect to the VPC Endpoint (it will time out because there is no route to it in the private subnet)

To connect to the VPC Endpoint, we have to use a URL like 'email-smtp.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com' (the private DNS name of the endpoint)

However, if you specify this URL in the `endpoint_url` param to the Boto3 constructor, it will fail with:

```
Invalid endpoint: email-smtp.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com
```
**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like to be able to send email via the VPC Endpoint, which I suspect will mean being able to override the `endpoint_url`.

If I have misunderstood anything regarding usage of boto3, then please do clarify.

items.title: DeprecationWarning : Avoid a warning in RegEx pattern

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue is a duplicate.

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This issue requests an improvement to a current feature.

items.body:
This line:

https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/9756eecba72474f97d33e3fbbc9e53a254ca8da8/boto3/resources/params.py#L22

Causes this warning (under PyTest) :

```
../lib/python3.7/site-packages/boto3/resources/params.py:22: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \[
    INDEX_RE = re.compile('\[(.*)\]$')
```

When it is [updated to](https://stackoverflow.com/a/50504635/2839786) this:

```python
INDEX_RE = re.compile(r'\[(.*)\]$')
```

The warning is gone.

items.title: How to Stream mp4 from private bucket using django as a proxy?
items.body:
Hello,

I try to return a response to stream a video from a private bucket.
To do that my django server will get the video from S3 and return a response.

```
def get_video_from_fragment(self, request, custom_id=None):
		s3 = AmazonApi()
		streaming_body = s3.get_file_to_stream(fragment.video.file)
		if streaming_body is None:
			return Response({'details': "error retreiving the video"}, status=500)
		response = StreamingHttpResponse(streaming_content=streaming_body)
		response['Content-Disposition'] = f'attachment; filename="{fragment.video.filename}"'

		return response
```

It work well for Chrome and Firefox but not for Safari.

I read for Safari that the content need to be delivered with a 206 status code.
The things is that my Nginx already deliver well the statics files (mp4 in this case) but not this kind of response.

I tried to add 
```
response = StreamingHttpResponse(streaming_content=streaming_body, status=206)
```
but in fact, it doesn't change anything.
I test with a curl like they do on their [documentation (from apple)](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/CreatingVideoforSafarioniPhone/CreatingVideoforSafarioniPhone.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40006514-SW6)

![Imgur](https://i.imgur.com/XdsSm97.png)

I suppose that my nginx (or django) know how to manage my .mp4 files but don't know how to do with call that return a StreamingHttpResponse.

Also I check how others website deliver their content and I see on my Safari console network tab a difference on the status.
For example google website has a status code on Response Headers
![Imgur](https://i.imgur.com/3g7bg11.png)

but mine are only on the summary part.

So how I can manage to deliver content from S3 using django as a proxy?

**What issue did you see ?**

I am seeing a weird issue with Lambda invocation when using boto3 client. Here is a brief summary:

boto3 client times out (`ReadTimeoutError`) after synchronously invoking long running lambda even after lambda finishes. This seems to only happen if the lambda function takes >350sec (even though the Lambda is configured with Timeout=600). I can confirm from AWS console and CW logs that the lambda finishes in ~350sec, but for some reason the boto3 client invocation times out after the boto3's config `read_timeout` of 900sec. This doesn't happen if the lambda runs <350sec.

```
import logging
import time

log = logging.getLogger(__name__)


def my_handler(event, context):
    t1 = time.time()

    response = {
        "I TOOK TIME": time.time() - t1,

    log.debug(f"final response: {response}")
```

```
import boto3
config = botocore.config.Config(
```

labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

items.body:
Look at https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/s3.html#S3.Client.put_bucket_policy (retrieved 7 May 2020 at 19:00 GMT):

> If you don't have `PutBucketPolic` y permissions, Amazon S3 returns a `403 Access Denied error`. If you have the correct permissions, but you're not using an identity that belongs to the bucket owner's account, Amazon S3 returns a `405 Method Not Allowed` error.

That "y" in the first sentence should be part of `PutBucketPolicy`, I think?

items.title: `proxy` option in `botocore.config.Config` does not mirror environment variable behavior.

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Setting the environment variable `https_proxy` gives different behavior compared to setting `proxies` in `botocore.config.Config` when getting an object from `s3`

**Steps to reproduce**
This program hangs when trying to get an `s3` object:

```python
import os
import boto3
import botocore

#os.environ['https_proxy'] = 'http://myproxy:82'
bucket = 'mybucket'
key = 'mykey'
session = boto3.Session(profile_name='default')
botoconfig = botocore.config.Config(
        proxies={'https': 'http://myproxy:82'})
s3 = session.resource('s3', config=botoconfig)
obj = s3.Object(bucket, key).get()
print(obj)
```

In the logs, it hangs on: 

`2020-05-06 10:22:29,659 urllib3.connectionpool [DEBUG] Starting new HTTPS connection (2): sts.amazonaws.com:443`

But if you uncomment the setting of `os.environ['https_proxy']`, it works as expected.

**Expected behavior**
I would expect that setting the proxy in the config would yield the same results as setting the environment variable.

```python
import boto3
s3 = boto3.client('s3')
s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object', Params={'Bucket': 'my-bucket', 'Key': 'Screenshot 2020-05-01 at 10.35.08.png'}, ExpiresIn=300)
```

**Expected behavior**
As S3 accepts files with these special names, I would expect the presigned url to get me to that file. Not sure if this is an issue with S3 or the boto3 package.

**Debug logs**
Will do if required: Full stack trace by adding `boto3.set_stream_logger('')` to your code.

items.body:
Hello, I've been struggling for some time now to use boto3 to read the data from Kinesis Video Stream.

**What issue did you see ?**
I can read the bytes from the StreamingBody response but some part of my video is missing. I can't find how to get the flag AWS_KINESISVIDEO_CONTINUATION_TOKEN to continue the stream.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/kinesis-video-media/get-media.html

I would like to continuously loop and read my stream by using the continuation token but I can't find a way to retrieve it from the response.

I am probably doing something wrong but I can't find what. Thanks!

edit: I can get all the bytes from my video though. I can write it on the disk, if I play it, the video stops after 2 seconds (VLC) but if I use ffmpeg to convert it to mp4, the video plays normally until the end.

My objective is:

* get some chunk of my video stream
* extract images, loop over them
* execute machine learning on them to detect objects
* if some specific object is detected, send the image for further analysis to somewhere else (S3, Kinesis Data, ...)

Currently, I can't find a way to do that with the StreamingBody. I can read all the bytes, use imageio and loop through the frames but the problem is that I have to read all the bytes, I can't use the streaming bytes to do that.

**Steps to reproduce**
```python
import boto3

if __name__ == '__main__':
    stream_name = "my_stream"
    
    kinesis_video_client = boto3.client('kinesisvideo')
    response = kinesis_video_client.get_data_endpoint(StreamName=stream_name, APIName='GET_MEDIA')
    endpoint_url = response["DataEndpoint"]
    
    stream_read_config = dict()
    stream_read_config["StartSelectorType"] = "EARLIEST"
    
    kinesis_video_media = boto3.client('kinesis-video-media', endpoint_url=endpoint_url)
    response = kinesis_video_media.get_media(
        StreamName=stream_name,
        StartSelector=stream_read_config
    )
    response_metadata = response["ResponseMetadata"]
    if response_metadata["HTTPStatusCode"] == 200:
        payload = response["Payload"]
        content_type = response["ContentType"]
        with open('/tmp/video.mkv', 'wb') as video_file:
            video_bytes = payload.read()
            video_file.write(video_bytes)
```

**Debug logs**

items.title: Boto3 + Polly, silent failure without error

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
When using Boto3 to access Polly in the script below:
- Script runs without error but creates an empty .mp3 file.
- Credentials are valid as testing the same endpoint using default profile from the AWS CLI produces a valid .mp3 file.

Code is as follow and taken from AWS website samples:

```
"""Getting Started Example for Python 2.7+/3.3+"""
"""Install Boto3 (AWS current Python SDK) before executing: $pip install boto3"""
from boto3 import Session
from botocore.exceptions import BotoCoreError, ClientError
from contextlib import closing
import os
import sys
import subprocess
from tempfile import gettempdir

# Create a client using the credentials and region defined in the [adminuser] section of the AWS credentials file (~/.aws/credentials).
session = Session(profile_name="default") #changed adminuser to default (see ~/.aws/config file
polly = session.client("polly")

try: # Request speech synthesis
    response = polly.synthesize_speech(Text="Hello world!", OutputFormat="mp3", VoiceId="Joanna")
except (BotoCoreError, ClientError) as error: # The service returned an error, exit gracefully
    print(error)
    sys.exit(-1)

# Access the audio stream from the response
if "AudioStream" in response:
    # Note: Closing the stream is important because the service throttles on the number of parallel connections. Here we are using contextlib.closing to
    # ensure the close method of the stream object will be called automatically at the end of the with statement's scope.
        with closing(response["AudioStream"]) as stream:
            output = os.path.join(gettempdir(), "speech.mp3")
        try: # Open a file for writing the output as a binary stream
                with open(output, "wb") as file:
                    file.write(stream.read())
        except IOError as error: # Could not write to file, exit gracefully
            print(error)
            sys.exit(-1)
else: # The response didn't contain audio data, exit gracefully
    print("Could not stream audio")
    sys.exit(-1)

# Play the audio using the platform's default player
if sys.platform == "win32":
    os.startfile(output)
else: # The following works on macOS and Linux. (Darwin = mac, xdg-open = linux).
    opener = "open" if sys.platform == "darwin" else "mpg123" # "xdg-open" did not work it opened the file in text edit instead
    subprocess.call([opener, output])
```

items.title: GetLogEvents forward/backward paginators

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue is a duplicate.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: This issue requests a feature.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

CloudWatch Logs has a `GetLogEvents` API that is unusual in that it's paginated, but in two directions. So if you request log events, you'll get a `nextForwardToken` and a `nextBackwardToken`. `nextForwardToken` mostly works like conventional pagination tokens, but the other one goes backwards. I can write my own while loop over these but it'd be so much nicer to use the current pagination interface in boto3.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It would be great if this API had _two_ paginators defined for it, allowing us to go forwards or backwards as needed. Currently it has none.

items.title: In MTurk create_hit using `EqualTo` comparator throws Client Error.

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
I am creating an MTurk HIT through the boto3 API. When I use the EqualTo comparator in the QualificationRequirements argument I get the following error: 

> ClientError: An error occurred (ParameterValidationError) when calling the CreateHIT operation: The value "IT" is not valid for the parameter LocaleValue. LocaleValue must be null when used with the EqualTo comparator.. (1588065769677)

This is confusing because if the LocaleValue must be set to null, then this means that you can never specify a locale.

**Steps to reproduce**
I am running boto3-1.12.47, botocore-1.15.47

`client.create_hit(
    LifetimeInSeconds=123,
    MaxAssignments=123,
    AutoApprovalDelayInSeconds=123,
    AssignmentDurationInSeconds=123,
    Reward='0.01',
    Title='Select the best fitting category for this text',
    Keywords='text, classification, intent',
    Description='sample description',
    Question=question_xml,
    RequesterAnnotation='string',
    QualificationRequirements=[{'QualificationTypeId': 'Italian', 'Comparator': 'EqualTo',  'LocaleValues' [{'Country': 'IT'}]}]
)`

When I comment out the `QualificationRequirements` argument this API call works just fine. When I include the `QualificationRequirements` argument, I get the `LocaleValue must be null when used with the EqualTo comparator` error.

**Expected behavior**
I expect QualificationRequirements to allow you to set LocaleValue to a non-null country value.

items.title: Make textract availble with S3 buckets in a different region

labels.name: closing-soon
labels.description: This issue will automatically close in 7 days unless further comments are made.

labels.name: guidance
labels.description: Question that needs advice or information.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have PDF documents in an S3 bucket "X" in region "A". The only way to use textract with PDF documents is to use the asynchronous API start_document_text_detection (in python SDK) which only allow documents from S3.
But Textract is not available in region "A" so I call textract in region "B".
Though Textract in region "B" is unable to read S3 documents from a different region (not "B")...
So the only workaround is to create another S3 bucket "Y" in region "B", copy the data from "X" to "Y" and THEN use the start_document_text_detection with that "Y" bucket...

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I wish the API allows an additional parameter "Region" as such:
response = client.start_document_text_detection(
    DocumentLocation={
        'S3Object': {
            'Bucket': 'string',
            'Name': 'string',
            'Version': 'string',
            'Region': 'string'
        }
    },
    ClientRequestToken='string',
    JobTag='string',
    NotificationChannel={
        'SNSTopicArn': 'string',
        'RoleArn': 'string'
    }
)

This "Region" doesn't exist as you can see in the documentation:
https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/textract.html#Textract.Client.start_document_text_detection
